intro: Wenderothia bicarinata, commonly known as the two-edged wendigo, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
